name: Jinn
desc: Familiars of the Goddess of Flowers, birthed from intoxicating dreams and the bitter memories of loss.

customize.name: Nabu Malikata
customize.desc: The Goddess of Flowers, a friend of Greater Lord Rukkhadevata and King Deshret.

customize.text: The Jinn are Nabi Malikata's familiars.

customize.name: Al-Ahmar
customize.desc: The ruler of the Sumeru desert. He is also known as King Deshret.

customize.text:
After Nabu Malikata's death, Al-Ahmar promised the Jinn their mistress was destined to awake someday, so they began serving him.
Ay-Khanoum
"City of the Moon Maiden," that was build by Nabu Malikata and Al-Ahmar for the Jinn.
Gurabad
A city that rose and fell under the influence of the Mother of the Jinn, Liloupar.
Ormazd
A shepherd who became a ruler of Gurabad under Liloupar's influence.
Shirin
Kisra Parvezravan
Liloupar's children
Shiruyeh
Liloupar's grandson, Shirin and Kisra's son, who was the reason for a calamity called "Shiruyeh's Plague."

customize.name: Liloupar
customize.desc: The Mother of the Jinn, under whose influence Gurabad rose and fell.

customize.text:
The Mother of the Jinn gave powers to Ormazd to rule Gurabad and led to its fall.
Ferigees
The guardian of the City of the Moon Maiden and the Mother of the Jinn who became a seal on the Eternal Oasis.

customize.name: Jinni in the Magic Bottle — Liloupar, I
Jinni in the Magic Bottle — Liloupar, II
Jinni in the Magic Bottle — Liloupar, III
Jinni in the Magic Bottle — Liloupar
customize.desc:
Born from water lilies, Liloupar, the great Jinni, whose soul had been shattered due to an ancient punishment, was sealed in a transparent magic bottle.
Now, it seems that she has found a new master...

Although she only possesses a-hundred millionth of her previous great power, she will use what is left of her to help her master pass through the hot sand and ancient ruins of the Desert of Hadramaveth.

customize.name: The Shepherd and the Magic Bottle
Xiphos' Moonlight
customize.desc: This ancient double-edged sword glimmers with moonlight. It is said that a now-silent Jinni dwells within it.

customize.name: Makhaira Aquamarine
customize.desc: An ancient greatsword that gleams like the waters themselves. A thousand years of sand erosion has not dulled its unnaturally sharp edge one bit.

imgDesc.text: The Mother of Jinn, Liloupar, meets a shepherd, Ormazd.
Huvashtra the Tyrant, who was overthrown by Ormazd.

"...I, Ormazd, was once a humble shepherd in the desert. 'Twas by King Deshret's grace that I could muster my forces and overthrow Huvashtra the Tyrant..."
"King Deshret sent the great Jinni from the City of the Moon Maiden to assist me in building Gurabad and in gathering the wandering tribes of the desert. Since then, the common folk and the powerful alike have led prosperous lives under King Deshret's guidance..."
"I hereby half dedicate my beloved kingdom, my trusted subjects, and my obedient slaves to my immortal partner, Liloupar, to be hers in perpetuity, and the other half, I submit to my lord, King Deshret."
"When the time comes, I shall leave my kingdom and people behind — in white vestments I shall clad myself, as I offer a sacrifice of a thousand slaves..."
